hi: hi, I'm trying to apt-get something  but I keep getting the messag: E: Unable to lock the list directory
that means you're trying to run two interfaces to apt at the same time, or are not root
by interfaces to apt I include apt-get, aptitude, "Add Programs", Synaptic, Kynaptic, etc
say "ps aux | grep apt" and see if anything else with apt in its name is running
and to be sure you're root, say "whoami".  It should respond "root"
um, first let me be sure you're not killing anything essential.  Paste them here and give me the url: http://pastebin.com
ps aux lists every process that's running.  grep searches that output for a particular word and only prints the lines with that word on it
in linux/unix, | is a pipe.  It means take the output of the first program and use it as the input of the second program
okay, look at that.  See process 9292?  That's apt-get running there.  So, that's why you can't lock the directory

well I'll tell you how to kill it, but first be sure you want to.  To kill it, just say "kill 9292" to kill that process.  But first, why not try and figure out why it's running?  It seems to have started at the same time as /etc/cr.  What's in that file?
